items.name: AutoTile.Axis
items.summary: An axis along which a texture is tiled.

items.name: X_Pos
items.summary: Tiles an object along the x-axis in the positive direction.

items.name: X_Neg
items.summary: Tiles an object along the x-axis in the negative direction.

items.name: Y_Pos
items.summary: Tiles an object along the y-axis in the positive direction.

items.name: Y_Neg
items.summary: Tiles an object along the y-axis in the negative direction.

items.name: Z_Pos
items.summary: Tiles an object along the z-axis in the positive direction.

items.name: Z_Neg
items.summary: Tiles an object along the z-axis in the negative direction.

items.name: AutoTile.SubmeshTiling
items.summary: A representation of a submesh that can be individually tiled.

items.name: axis
items.summary: The axis along which the texture is tiled.

items.name: submeshIndex
items.summary: The submesh index of the material being tiled.

items.name: unitScale
items.summary:
The object's base unit scale. For example, planes have a unit
scale of 10 compared to most other primitives.

items.name: textureOffset
items.summary: The texture offset applied on the material.

items.name: AutoTile
items.summary: Automatically tiles the material's textures based on the object's scale.

items.name: renderer
items.summary: The renderer component of the material being tiled (Read only).

items.name: submeshes
items.summary: The submeshes that are tiled on the renderer.

items.name: textureNames
items.summary: The names of the textures that are tiled on the material.

items.name: autoUpdate
items.summary:
Whether the material texture(s) are tiled automatically when the
transform changes.

items.name: Tile()
items.summary:
Updates the tiling properties of the material(s) based on the
current scale of the object.

items.name: colorA

items.name: colorB
items.summary: The second color of the checkerboard.

parameters.description: The texture to set the pixels on.

items.summary: The name of the combined mesh.

items.name: combineOnStart
items.summary: Combines the mesh on start, otherwise it needs to be called manually.

items.name: deleteChildren
items.summary: Destroys the child game objects after combining.

items.name: mergeSubmeshes
items.summary: Combines all of the meshes into a single submesh.

items.name: optimizeMesh
items.summary: Optimizes the combined mesh data to improve rendering performance.

items.name: recalculateBounds
items.summary: Recalculates the bounding volume of the combined mesh.

items.name: Combine()
items.summary: Combines the meshes of the children of this game object.

return.description: A new combined mesh.

items.name: RenderingMode
items.summary: A rendering blend mode of a material.

items.name: Opaque
items.summary:
The default rendering mode, and suitable for normal solid objects
with no transparent areas.

items.name: Cutout
items.summary:
Allows you to create a transparent effect that has hard edges
between the opaque and transparent areas. In this mode, there are no
semi-transparent areas, the texture is either 100% opaque, or
invisible. This is useful when using transparency to create the
shape of materials such as leaves, or cloth with holes and tatters.

items.name: Fade
items.summary:
Allows the transparency values to entirely fade an object out,
including any specular highlights or reflections it may have. This
mode is useful if you want to animate an object fading in or out. It
is not suitable for rendering realistic transparent materials such
as clear plastic or glass because the reflections and highlights
will also be faded out.

items.name: Transparent
items.summary:
Suitable for rendering realistic transparent materials such as clear
plastic or glass. In this mode, the material itself will take on
transparency values (based on the texture’s alpha channel and the
alpha of the tint colour), however reflections and lighting
highlights will remain visible at full clarity as is the case with
real transparent materials.

items.name: SaveMesh
items.summary: Saves the mesh of a mesh filter as a project asset.

items.summary: Saves the mesh as a project asset.

Maps the UV coordinates in the range [0..1] to pixel coordinates
in the range [0..width-1] and [0..height-1].

[0..height-1] to UV coordinates in the range [0..1].

inside a rectangle.
